name: React.js Developer
description:
Healthcare is experiencing a global shift, opening up exciting new opportunities in technology. In the world of software engineering, there are few areas where you can have more impact. Your work will assist doctors, lab techs, pharmacists, nurses, and others involved in helping patients improve their health. The products you work on play a material role in saving lives and improving patient care, and the quality of those solutions is key.


About the role

We’re looking for an experienced full-stack developer to join our Auckland team. You’ll be building functional, intuitive and beautiful web-based user interfaces working initially on two very exciting internal projects. As a React.js Developer, you will be involved from conception to completion with projects that are technologically sound and aesthetically impressive.

Immersed in a culture of collaboration, learning and software engineering excellence, you’ll quickly extend your Front End and UI skills within strong cross discipline project teams. You will also work closely with the Digital Marketing Manager to ensure our web presence stands out from the competition.

Developing a flexible and well-structured front-end architecture, along with the APIs to support it, you’ll be confident using UI/UX designs and wireframes to create the respective code and application. You’ll enjoy optimising components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.


About You

You like to get stuck in and have a positive, open minded and energetic attitude. You have an eye for detail, enjoy understanding how things work under the hood, excellent verbal and written communication skills, and thrive in a collaborative, professional work environment.

You’ll have solid experience of the following tools and techniques:

  • Sound knowledge of modern front-end build pipelines and tools
  • Experience with code versioning tools such as Git
  • Experience with popular React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux)
  • Familiarity with GatsbyJS
  • In-depth knowledge of Javascript, CSS, HTML and front-end languages
  • Knowledge of REACT tools
  • Excellent troubleshooting skills
  • Good project management skills

In return, Orion Health offers

  • Defined career paths for all roles and across business functions
  • Be supported by mentoring and coaching systems
  • Competitive salary package
  • Breakfast, fruit, freshly ground coffee daily
  • Flexible and social, but professional company culture
  • Unique learning, travel and career growth prospects

If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you!

name: Front-end React JavaScript Software Developer
description:
Skillsme is looking to expand and as a result, we are looking for a talented React.js Developer to grow our platform.

The Role:

As an Intermediate Front-end React.js Developer.
Build high quality UI components using React and Redux
Use API calls.
Work in a collaborative environment with existing developers and other technical team members. Enhance existing functionalities and contribute new features.
Adapt changes and provide innovative solutions.
Develop & design the new product and improve existing products.

Skill and Experience Prefer:

Strong, Intermediate commercial experience with Front End React Development.
Strong experience building Web applications.
Wider JavaScript framework experience is preferred.
Experience working in an Agile environment.
Strong attention to detail and analytical skills.
Ideally expertise across Redux, WebPack, Promises, Git.
Excellent communication skills.

Apply now on Indeed & complete our online assessment at https://beta.myskillsme.com/sessions/signin

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $70,000.00 – $80,000.00 per year

Experience:

  • web development: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Eligibility:

  • Permitted to work permanently with no restriction on hours (e.g. citizen, permanent resident) (Preferred)

Work Remotely:

  • Yes

name: Front End React.js / Redux Developer
description:
• Great tech in a start-up environment
  • Work with high performance technology, including Blazor
  • Early phase, with great industry support


An awesome SaaS startup in Wellington is heading into their first round of recruitment, and looking for a Front End Developer with strong React.js / Redux knowledge, and potentially interested in moving to a Blazor environment in the future. With that comes the opportunity to get elbows deep at an early stage, where you can have huge exposure and work directly with a very strong technical leadership team. Seriously punching above their weight in ID and credential management, they have been recognised by both Microsoft and the NZ energy industry, bringing huge opportunities in both execution and market share.

Digitising a manual training records process, they bring a huge amount of additional support, security and confidence to the energy industry, with a scalable SaaS application with heaps more space to grow. Locally built, and backed by a big player in the global ID market, they have the best of both worlds, small enough to make a difference and with the scope to be something really special.

What will I be doing?
  • Making good looking, accessible and awesome user experiences
  • Support and enhance our web applications
  • Diagnosing and resolve front end workflow, usability and code issues
  • Continuously improve our solutions
  • Documentation for our applications
What do I need to know?
  • Specialist knowledge of front end technologies, including JavaScript and DOM manipulation, React.js, Redux, HTML/CSS and NPM. If you are looking to widen your skills, they are already looking at Blazor as their “next generation” Front End platform
  • Contemporary knowledge API/REST interfaces (such as using Swagger) including modern authentication such as OpenID and Oauth utilising JWT, JWS
  • Familiarity with modern code management, build pipelines and tools with Azure DevOps and Git being our primary toolset for this
  • Microsoft Azure services in general such as App services and functions for serverless applications. Knowledge of Azure Service bus would be an advantage
  • Data exchange standards, formats and schemas such as JSON Schema, web hooks etc
  • Even more of a bonus if you have done any work with Web Assembly; including PWAs
We’d love to see some of this, but it’s not a dealbreaker
  • They are a .Net shop some so knowledge of C# and will be preferable so you can read the code and can contribute to discussions.
  • Knowledge of Identity standards such as W3C Verifiable credentials, DID and any wider knowledge of the self-sovereign identity ecosystem
If you want to work in a tight, high performing team with some cutting edge technologies and a project with a huge future, then drop us a line here or email peter@talent.army to set up a discreet chat.

name: Intermediate Developer
description:
Why you would like it:

  • Fintech product development, and your joining at the start of the journey!

  • Be front and center of a world first & game changer!

  • Flexible and modern software development approach

The opportunity:

You will be joining a newly formed squad that has the backing to build a product from scratch that addresses a very interesting new marketplace in the financial services realm. You will be working closely with your team and the CTO, while helping to build production ready code and a highly scalable and secure product using modern JavaScript tools, frameworks and libraries.

This is the kind of product you can look back on in a few years and really feel like you have changed and positively contributed to the businesses landscape for the better.

Company profile:

You will most likely know Centrality for bringing together the brightest minds locally and internationally in the decentralised systems space. However, they also house and support the growth of a number of emerging startups (decentralised backing or not). Headquartered here in Auckland CBD, they are a modern product development shop with flexible working arrangements and a well grounded global culture.

The skillset:

Intermediate level experience with:

  • Javascript (Native)

  • React (what they are currently using) - not worried if you can pivot quickly from another framework like Vue.js or Angular.js

  • Node.js

  • HTML, CSS

  • Good understanding and experience with Automated testing approaches


If you are an open minded, motivated and practical Software Engineer with a particular flare for all things Fullstack JS and scalable products, then this opportunity will be one to go for!

Send us your CV or if you meet the brief above and would like to ask some questions before applying, give Sam Nowell a call on 021673467.


  • Kaylee Robinson Executive Recruitment Assistant
  • kaylee@potentia.co.nz
  • 09 600 3931

name: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Why Vacasa

We started with just one home and an idea: to bring homeowners and renters together with smart technology and caring local teams. Today, we're the largest full-service vacation rental company in the US thanks to the people who give us their best every day. You'll fit right in here if you're curious, collaborative, innovative, and thrive in a rapid-growth environment.

Why Software Engineering at Vacasa

Do you want to be part of an NZ team helping the largest vacation property management company in the US solve problems on a global scale? Are you excited to explore the benefits of scalability and performance by leveraging modern, cloud-based technologies? At Vacasa, we are constantly experimenting and fine-tuning our products. We value stability, security, and scalability.

What we are looking for

Vacasa is looking for passionate Senior Software Engineers for our fast-growing engineering organization. At Vacasa, we value team independence and ownership, rapid delivery and continuous improvement.

In this role, you would be part of a cross-functional team building scalable, cloud-native solutions to high-impact business problems. You'll be working with Node.js for back-end services and with React for front-end applications.

What you'll do with your team

As a Senior Software Engineer, you'll be a key member of your team, solving mission-critical problems and being a hands-on contributor to our ever-evolving systems. We believe to shine in this role, you're good at:

  • Designing, architecting, and building software; applying current technology thinking and patterns to our business problems
  • Guiding developers via code reviews, discussion and modeling of code that is easy to evolve and read
  • Continuously learning new technologies and validating concepts in order to pick the right tool for the job
  • Utilizing DevOps tools and practices for building, deploying, and maintaining software in production environments
  • Participating and building a collaborative, productive culture around product-focused goals
  • Building towards high quality standards and working with your team to create robust testing approaches

Skills you'll need

  • 5+ years of professional experience using two or more languages and working with multiple back-end data storage technologies
  • Ability to write high-quality, well-tested code that places maintainability over cleverness; know when and what to optimize for in a given situation
  • Adept at guiding technical direction within a cross-functional engineering team
  • Experience in cloud platforms with Infrastructure as Code
  • Experience and enthusiasm to mentor junior engineers

Nice to have

  • Completed a B.S./M.S. in Computer Science (or equivalent work experience)
  • Experience with React, Node.js, JavaScript/TypeScript
  • AWS Serverless tech
  • Mobile app development experience
  • Experience in hospitality or travel industry

Working with us has its benefits

  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Flexible work environment
  • A fancy new Macbook Pro
  • Great colleagues and culture

name: Junior Dynamics 365 Consultants
description:
Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.
Our team
Welcome to the team! Join New Zealand’s biggest dedicated Dynamics 365 practice and work within New Zealand’s biggest IT firm! Our scale and experience means we get to do the most interesting, complex and challenging Dynamics 365 projects that this country (& Australia) has to offer. Don’t be scared by our size, as our team exists and operates with autonomy within the wider Datacom business, giving us the best of both worlds, scale and support as well flexibility and the remit to carve a new path for ourselves. We’re on the lookout for passionate, talented, smart and dedicated people to continue our growth and success.
About the Role
We’re looking for a super switched on, driven Junior Consultants who would love to kick-start a career within our Dynamics 365 team. You’ll have the support of our senior technical consultants and wider team to get you up to speed with what we do and how we do it. You’ll have the opportunity to develop as a Technical Consultant or a Functional Consultant where you’ll be responsible for understanding a customers problem, and delivering solutions to help them achieve their goals. This is a varied but challenging role to test your design, delivery, innovative thinking and technical abilities, and with challenge comes reward. Before no time, you’ll be confident at leading technical discussion, eliciting requirements, crafting solutions and articulating complex technical CRM or ERP concepts.
In this role you’ll be across multiple projects with high profile clients. Our projects are typically end to end deliveries, combing both CRM and ERP together and pairing with portals, mobile and deep integration to customer systems. If it’s big and hairy challenges you are after, then we are the place for you!
What you’ll bring
We’re looking for savvy, confident candidates who come from Commerce, Accounting, Engineering or Computer Science degrees. We will provide a mentoring and learning framework to get you up to speed, but you’ll need genuine interest to develop a career as a technical/functional consultant as you’ll be constantly challenged to get up to speed – working and presenting directly to clients. You’ll be ready to step into a role where you’ll be constantly challenged, and willing to grasp onto presenting and working directly with clients.
You’ll be an expert at thinking creatively, investigating and coming up with solutions to complex and exciting problems. You may have graduated from any degree, but whatever it’s likely to have included a technology and computer science bent. It’s advantageous if you have familiarity with concepts of CRM or ERP systems, such as sales, marketing, accounting and supply chain.
For a technical role, you’ll be familiar with .NET, C#, JavaScript, and React. In addition, front end development experience such as react, or JS is a bonus.
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
If this sounds like the kick-start you’re after, please apply online

name: Node.JS Developer
description:
About the role

We have a lot happening at Invenco, and continue to grow in North America, APAC & Europe. Our Software team are building new applications to support our customer - and it is a great time to join as a developer.


We are currently on the look out for a Node.JS Developer - this role will be responsible to design, build and maintain software solutions with a commitment to delivering quality solutions on time that meet or exceed the needs of our internal and external customers. The Node.JS Developer will be actively involved in:

  • Software development
  • Software documentation
  • Software testing
  • Team mentoring

Skills & Experience
We are looking for a Node.JS Developer who is experienced in working on RESTful APIs in a service architecture, and experienced working in a cloud (ideally AWS) environment. The ideal candidate must understand Promises and Generators in addition to the traditional callback methodology. Experience using the Restify (as opposed to Express) package to facilitate the REST interfaces would be a must have. In addition to this, the right candidate will have:

  • Tertiary qualification in Computer Science or Information Technology, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Advanced knowledge and experience in the following: JavaScript, - Node.js using Restify, - RESTful APIs, - PostgreSQL and Asynchronous programming techniques, Code versioning and revision systems such as GitHub
  • Writing secure code that complies with appropriate standards and regulations
  • Knowledge around PostreSQL for data, or other relational databases
  • Experience working within a Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment environment.
  • AWS, Azure or similar cloud technology experience
  • Code versioning and revision systems such as GitHub
  • If you have some Angular/React experience that will help our website guys, however this is not a primary focus

Please Note:
As part of our recruitment process, a technical online test must be completed.

We will be considering applicants based locally due to the nature and urgency of this hiring. Citizenship, PR, Work visa or a Working Holiday Visa is required to apply.


About Invenco
Invenco uniquely builds highly complex end-to-end payment solutions from hardware through the firmware and middleware stack plus cloud – all under one roof. In revolutionising the global customer payment experience it’s one of New Zealand’s most awarded tech-companies – including being named 2018 NZ Hi-Tech company of the year. We continue to attract world-class talent as Invenco faces exponential growth in APAC, EMEA, the US and Canada. There has never been a better time to join us as we expand our global development and applications team.

Benefits
We’re based on Auckland’s North Shore just minutes from the Northern Motorway.
Our benefits include working with a great team, performance-based pay, training and development opportunities, challenging work, flexible work hours, paid birthday leave, discounted medical insurance, onsite gym and access to EAP services. We have a lot happening at Invenco and it's an exciting time to join as we expand globally.
www.invenco.com

name: Senior Front End Developer
description:
Senior Frontend Developer

  • Up to $135,000 per annum (depending on experience)
• Parking onsite and off street
• Flexi hours

ABOUT THE COMPANY
Innovative organisation working on a digital and unique B2B solution. Very cool and new age company which is growing fast!

ABOUT THE ROLE
We’re looking for an experienced Senior Frontend Developer with a “can-do” attitude. The role will be a mix of coding, developing, support and maintenance as well as proposing new ideas to enhance the platform. The main project you’ll be working on is a mobile app, however there will be other pieces of work you’ll be contributing to.
This organisation very much welcomes the thoughts of its employees and is after someone that can work autonomously and is comfortable running a dedicated project and taking all the responsibilities.

Responsibilities:

  • Continuing the transitioning to their React frontend
  • Collaborating on new features and the product vision
  • Adding new and extending existing features
  • Paying down technical debt by refactoring old code
  • Improving frontend practices
  • Championing automated testing
  • Championing code reviews
  • Championing Internal documentation
  • Extending our Mobile (Flutter) app with the next set of features

ABOUT YOU
You are a seasoned frontend UX expert with solid commercial experience and knowledge of React, ES6, Typescript. You practice and preach unit/integration testing, enjoy reviewing PRs, working in a close-knit team and keeping up to date with your craft. You relish clean and well architectured code. You are pragmatic, results oriented, and get a strong sense of satisfaction knowing customers are using your UI to make their lives easier.
You may not have any mobile cross platform development experience (eg RN, Flutter) but have an interest in doing so. Whilst your primary language is JS you are comfortable learning new languages and frameworks and probably have used a variety of other programming languages in a past lifetime which gives you wisdom beyond your years.

COMPANY CULTURE & BENEFITS
Flexible working hours and ability to partly work from home. Smart casual dress-code. A great location and offices plus an amazing work environment. Be part of a fast-growing organisation!


HOW TO APPLY
Click the APPLY button and include your resume and cover letter or for further information please call Regie on 093025312 or email to regie.saylo@absoluteit.co.nz

NOTE to overseas enquiries and non-NZ residents:
Whereas we welcome international enquiries, only applicants that are legally entitled to work in New Zealand and can make themselves available for interviews in New Zealand will be considered for advertised positions.
Others may not necessarily be responded to.

name: Senior Front End Developer
description:
Resn is looking for a full time senior creative Javascript and CSS/HTML developer for our studio in Wellington, New Zealand.


You'll be working on the biggest and brightest international brands in global time zones (with a focus on APAC and USA). Your peerless development skills ensure that projects are completed to the highest standards, on time, within budget and with a smile on everyone's dials.


What sets you apart is your ability to make the front end come to life through code driven animations, transitions and little touches of class. You have a keen visual eye and understand the importance of getting it to look amazing. You care as much about the visuals as you do about the code.


You possess a deep understanding about the limitations of browsers and devices as you try to squeeze every drop of performance out of them.


Responsibilities

  • Hands-on front-end development for multiple projects including, but not limited to, campaign microsites, web based applications, large scale complex Javascript mobile and desktop websites, 3D experiences, games, installations, experiments and AR/VR experiences.
  • Defining project front end requirements, assisting with technical design documentation, project budget estimates and assessing feasibility of technical deliverables with your esteemed Creative and Producer colleagues.
  • Research and development into latest and greatest front end wizardry and processes.
  • Project tech leadership role as required.


Skills and Experience

  • 5+ years of development experience, ideally at senior or tech lead level.
  • Broad experience and solid understanding of interactive web technologies and front-end development using Javascript, HTML, CSS/LESS/SASS, Vue.js.
  • Experience working on large and complex interactive projects with multidisciplinary creative and technical teams.
  • Experience with short production timelines, hard deadlines, and moving targets.
  • A love of planning, scrumming combined with fantastic written and verbal communication skills.
  • The ability to maintain composure and focus when the escalating demands of work rear up like a rampant wildebeest.
  • Unbounding optimism and the desire to achieve the impossible!


Bonus Points

  • Experience with Three.js / GLSL / React Native / Unity.
  • Any other visually driven development languages.


Check us out

www.resn.co.nz

name: Senior Back-End Developer
description:
Resn is looking for a full time Senior Back-End Developer for our studio in Wellington, New Zealand.


You'll be working on the biggest and brightest international brands in global time zones (with a focus on APAC and USA). Your peerless back-end development skills ensure that projects are completed to the highest standards, on time, within budget and with a smile on everyone's dials.


Your developer experience stack is full, and you possess a deep understanding of web services and technologies.


Responsibilities

  • Lead back-end development for multiple projects including, but not limited to, campaign microsites, web based applications, large scale complex Javascript mobile and desktop websites, 3D experiences, games, installations, experiments and AR/VR experiences.
  • Defining project back end requirements, assisting with technical design documentation, project budget estimates and assessing feasibility of technical deliverables with your esteemed Creative and Producer colleagues.
  • Serve as a technical contact for third-party vendors and production partners, identifying and documenting integration points with third party solutions.
  • Work closely with clients technical teams to effectively manage integration with client infrastructures and compliance with security systems.
  • Hands-on implementation of development infrastructure
  • Hosting recommendations / set-up / Deployment Implementation / Overall management
  • Research and development into latest and greatest back end systems and processes


Skills and Experience

  • 5+ years of development experience, ideally at senior or tech lead level.
  • Experience setting up and maintaining development and deployment pipelines, including familiarity with Webpack, Rollup, npm, gulp, GIT, Yarn and Bitbucket Pipelines.
  • Deep understanding of hosting and domain setup and management, network infrastructures and protocols, web security, server-side architectures and back-end strategies for a wide variety of situations, with familiarity with AWS and GCP.
  • Experience working on large and complex interactive projects with multidisciplinary creative and technical teams.
  • Experience with short production timelines, hard deadlines, and moving targets.
  • Working with and processing server-side media content, e.g. video compositing with ffmpeg, audio processing sox, image processing, streaming video.
  • A love of planning, scrumming combined with fantastic written and verbal communication skills.
  • The ability to maintain composure and focus when the escalating demands of work rear up like a rampant wildebeest.
  • Unbounding optimism and the desire to achieve the impossible!


Bonus Points

  • Broad experience and solid understanding of interactive web technologies and front-end development using Javascript, HTML, CSS/LESS/SASS, Vue.js.
  • Experience with Three.js / GLSL / React Native / Unity.
  • Any other visually driven development languages.


Check us out

name: Solution Architect/Lead Developer
description:
Tauranga

Flexible working options

About the role:
The Solution Architect/Lead Developer is responsible for working with the development teams, providing technical advice, architectural guidance to deliver high quality solutions for customers. This role does not have any HR responsibilities. The role is focused on the technical implementation, design, and delivery of solutions. The role is envisaged to be made up of 25% architecture, 25% presales support / prototyping / 50% hands on development as part of the team. You will be part of the senior technical team and report to the Head of Development.

Skills required for this role:
5+ years of solid hands-on experience in Microsoft C#, ASP.Net (Web Forms & MVC), .Net Core, MS SQL AND / OR Java Spring, Spring Boot, PostgresSQL etc

Solid knowledge of databases and data structures used in modern web and mobile application context

3+ years of experience designing and working with API driven applications

3+ years of solution architecture experience

Good understanding of client-side languages, technologies and practices; HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, AngularJs and or React JS, W3C compliance and accessibility experience

Cloud Architecture experience with AWS and or Azure cloud platforms

Solution Architecture experience

Experience designing scalable, cloud first solutions

Experience with event and messaging systems (RabbitMQ, Kafka, SMS, SQS)

Solid experience in continuous integration and automated deployment

Excellent understanding of software development methodologies, including KISS, DRY and SOLID

Excellent attention to detail

Strong communication skills in all disciplines including written, oral, email and presentation

Capable of hands on problem-solving, with ability to generate ideas and solutions

Ability to travel to client sites where required

We'd love to hear from you, if this is the right role for you - APPLY now or contact Clare Saunders on 09 374 0876 or Mignon Green on 027 582 1129 or a confidential discussion.

Please note that you must be located in New Zealand to be considered for this contract role.

Ref: 105963

name: Senior Fullstack Developer
description:
Why you would like it:

  • Fintech product development, and your joining at the start of the journey!

  • Be front and center of a world first & game changer!

  • Flexible and modern software development approach

The opportunity:

You will be joining a newly formed squad that has the backing to build a product from scratch that addresses a very interesting new marketplace in the financial services realm. You will be working closely with your team and the CTO, while helping to build production ready code and a highly scalable and secure product using modern JavaScript tools, frameworks and libraries.

This is the kind of product you can look back on in a few years and really feel like you have changed and positively contributed to the businesses landscape for the better.

Company profile:

You will most likely know Centrality for bringing together the brightest minds locally and internationally in the decentralised systems space. However, they also house and support the growth of a number of emerging startups (decentralised backing or not). Headquartered here in Auckland CBD, they are a modern product development shop with flexible working arrangements and a well grounded global culture.

The skillset:

  • Senior level experience with:

    • Javascript (Native)

    • React (what they are currently using) - not worried if you can pivot quickly from another framework like Vue.js or Angular.js

    • Node.js

    • HTML, CSS

    • Good understanding and experience with Automated testing approaches

    • Bonus: Can define and lead architectural conversations with minimal guidance


If you are an open minded, motivated and practical Software Engineer with a particular flare for all things Fullstack JS and scalable products, then this opportunity will be one to go for!
